plot: Rodney is taking stick from the lads down the pub about his "imaginary" girlfriend, and Mickey Pearce bets him fifty that he won't bring a girl to the Nag's Head Saturday-night bash. When Rodney admits to Del that he was lying about the girl he's bringing to the party. Del sets about trying to get him a date. On Friday night the brothers go clubbing, and after trying just about every club in London, they end up in a seedy little bar where Del spots Yvonne, an old flame who, he remembers, isn't too picky about dates, and he offers to pay her part of the winnings from Rodney's bet if she'll escort his little bruv the following night. When Rodney gets home from The Nag's Head on Saturday night he's in tears. Apparently, the date went well--until halfway through the evening when Yvonne takes centre stage in the pub and starts stripping off in front of all of Rodney's mates. Del tries to console Rodders with the thought of his £50 winnings, but it turns out that the bet was for fifty pence, not pounds.—Rune Thandy

Rodney has bought two tickets for the tickets-only party at the Nag's Head on Saturday night, but he's still single, and Mickey Pearce bets his hapless mate that he can't find a girl to bring. Feeling like he wants to help Rodders save face and settle a score, Del encourages him to find a willing "bird." Rodney needs all the help he can get from Del to stand any chance of winning. Can he defy the odds and knock mouthy Mickey off his perch?—stevecann2003
